channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Diane Keaton, beloved actress and style icon, dies at 79
item.description: Diane Keaton has died at 79 — the Oscar-winning actress was known for Annie Hall and The Godfather films. New Yorker critic Michael Schulman reflects on her career and enduring influence.
item.content:encoded: Diane Keaton has died at 79 — the Oscar-winning actress was known for Annie Hall and The Godfather films. New Yorker critic Michael Schulman reflects on her career and enduring influence.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: How puppets from Chile became NPR's newest Tiny Desk sensation
item.description: Alt.Latino host Anamaria Sayre tells the story of how Chilean puppet show 31 Minutos became an international sensation after their Tiny Desk performance.
item.content:encoded: Alt.Latino host Anamaria Sayre tells the story of how Chilean puppet show 31 Minutos became an international sensation after their Tiny Desk performance.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Eighteen missing after explosion at Tennessee explosives plant
item.description: Cynthia Abrams with NPR Member station WPLN reports from Humphreys County, where officials say at least 18 people are missing and feared dead after an explosion at a military explosives plant.
item.content:encoded: Cynthia Abrams with NPR Member station WPLN reports from Humphreys County, where officials say at least 18 people are missing and feared dead after an explosion at a military explosives plant.
item.dc:creator: Cindy Abrams

item.title: What Uvalde's new school looks like, three years after tragedy
item.description: Texas Public Radio's Camille Phillips reports from Uvalde, where a new school built with security upgrades opens three years after the Robb Elementary shooting.
item.content:encoded: Texas Public Radio's Camille Phillips reports from Uvalde, where a new school built with security upgrades opens three years after the Robb Elementary shooting.
item.dc:creator: Camille Phillips

item.title: How to win the Nobel Prize in Literature
item.description: Author and critic Lincoln Michel talks about Hungarian writer László Krasznahorkai's Nobel win and what it shows about who gets recognized in world literature.
item.content:encoded: Author and critic Lincoln Michel talks about Hungarian writer László Krasznahorkai's Nobel win and what it shows about who gets recognized in world literature.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: He risked his life to reach the Canary Islands, but getting there was only the start
item.description: After surviving a dangerous sea crossing, many migrants who reach Spain's Canary Islands find themselves stranded for months, unable to work and clinging to the hope that life will be better once they reach mainland Spain.
item.content:encoded: After surviving a dangerous sea crossing, many migrants who reach Spain's Canary Islands find themselves stranded for months, unable to work and clinging to the hope that life will be better once they reach mainland Spain.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: Could President Trump really use the U.S. military against Americans?
item.description: National security scholar Tom Nichols argues that Trump has taken control of the nation's intelligence and justice systems and is now testing the military's independence.
item.content:encoded: National security scholar Tom Nichols argues that Trump has taken control of the nation's intelligence and justice systems and is now testing the military's independence.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: As Israel and Hamas prepare for a major exchange, President Trump heads to Israel
item.description: President Trump is expected to arrive in Israel on Sunday night as both sides prepare for the release of Israeli hostages and nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees and prisoners.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is expected to arrive in Israel on Sunday night as both sides prepare for the release of Israeli hostages and nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees and prisoners.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Oyster farmer and veteran Graham Platner hopes his message lands with Maine voters
item.description: In Maine, oyster farmer and military veteran Graham Platner has become something of a phenomenon in his bid to topple Republican Sen. Susan Collins in next year's midterm election.
item.content:encoded: In Maine, oyster farmer and military veteran Graham Platner has become something of a phenomenon in his bid to topple Republican Sen. Susan Collins in next year's midterm election.
item.dc:creator: Steve Mistler

item.title: Singer-songwriter Madi Diaz is out with a new stripped-down album, 'Fatal Optimist'
item.description: Nashville singer-songwriter Madi Diaz is out with her new album. Fatal Optimist an introspective album that is her most stripped down, acoustic record to date.
item.content:encoded: Nashville singer-songwriter Madi Diaz is out with her new album. Fatal Optimist an introspective album that is her most stripped down, acoustic record to date.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
